entry.title: Inflation Accounting in Türkiye – Index-Based Asset Revaluation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, SAP now supports a significant legal requirement in Türkiye: index-based asset revaluation. (Inflation Accounting). 
Note: For the "What's New" Article, please click here.

This regulation, mandated by Turkish tax and commercial law, requires companies to revalue their fixed assets based on monthly inflation indices published by the Turkish Statistical Institute (TÜİK).
This blog provides an overview of the legal requirement and explains how to meet it by demonstrating the implementation steps for a sample scenario.

About Index-Based Asset Revaluation in Türkiye

Index-based asset revaluation is a legal requirement in Türkiye introduced under the Vergi Usul Kanunu Genel Tebliği (Sıra No: 555), published in the Official Gazette (issue 32415, 30.12.2023).
This regulation requires companies to adjust their financial statements based on producer price indices published by TÜİK (Turkish Statistical Institute).

The calculation of the adjustment coefficient is defined in Article 17 of the Vergi Usul Kanunu Genel Tebliği (Sıra No: 555), published in the official Gazette (Resmi Gazete, issue 32415, 30.12.2023):

  • Five decimal places must be considered in the calculation.
  • The fifth digit must be rounded based on the sixth digit.

The official index values can be found here.

Note: Each customer is responsible for ensuring that the maintained index values and resulting calculations (including rounding) comply with the legal requirements!

 

Implementation Guide

This section explains the implementation steps of index-based revaluation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for a sample scenario involving a simple asset. It lists the steps required to complete the set-up, posting, valuation checks, a partial retirement, and (optionally) a reversal.

Note:

  • The revaluation is not carried out in a separate depreciation area, but within the valuation view where the index is assigned (e.g. 1 = Book Depreciation, 15 = Local Tax).
  • Customers should not use the scope item for additional depreciation areas for this purpose, as adding extra areas does not support the revaluation process and will not provide the intended outcome.

Scenario Details

  • Asset APC: 12,000 TRY
  • Useful life: 10 years (120 periods)
  • Valuation view: The view where the index is assigned (e.g., 1 = Book Depreciation or 15 = Local Tax)
  • Revaluation index: Monthly index (assigned before acquisition)
  • Scenario extension: Partial retirement of 70% on 01 Mach 2025; optional reversal of postings

Prerequisites

Maintain G/L account determination for revaluation in the Assign G/L Accounts (ID: 102622) configuration activity.

Step-by-Step Procedure

  1. Create revaluation index
    1. Open the Maintain Asset Revaluation Index app and create a new index with the following details:
      1. Revaluation Index ID: Freely selectable (e.g. INF_TR)
      2. Index Type: Replacement Value, Monthly
      3. Unit of Measure: Index Points
    2. Maintain the monthly index values published by TÜİK: TÜIK Inflation and Price Statistics

    3. Activate the revaluation index by clicking on "Activate" to make it available for valuation views.

       

  2. Maintain asset master data
    1. Open the Manage Fixed Assets app.
    2. Create a new asset and maintain all mandatory values (cost centre, profit centre, segment) and other values relevant to your business.
    3. Under Valuation → General Parameters, assign the revaluation index created in step 1.


    4. Adjust the useful life (in years) if necessary, for example, 10 years.
    5. Apply changes and save.

  3. Post acquisition of the asset
    1. In the Manage Fixed Assets app, choose Post → Post Acquisition → Acquisition (Net).

       

    2. In the new window, specify values for the following mandatory fields:
      1.          Journal Entry Date, Posting Date, Asset Value Date
      2.          Amount Posted in Transaction Currency (12,000 TRY in our example)
      3.          Year of Acquisition (Prior Year in our example)
    3. Choose Simulate to check the postings and then choose Post.

  4. View depreciation amounts
    1. In the Managed Fixed Assets app, go to Valuation to review the effects of revaluation.
    2. Under Value Display → Depreciation, you will see both the regular depreciation and the additional revaluation amounts

      Fiscal Year 2024:

      Fiscal Year 2025:

Scenario Extension: The asset was acquired in July 2024 for 12,000 TRY. In March 2025, 70% of the asset needs to be retired.

  1. In the Manage Fixed Assets app, choose Post → Post Retirement → Retirement without Revenue.


  2. Adjust the mandatory fields:
    • Journal Entry Date, Posting Date, Asset Value Date to 01.03.2025
    • Retirement Type: Partial Retirement by Percentage Rate
    • Retirement Percentage: 70 %
    • Year of Acquisition: Prior Year

    • Choose Post.
    • The results can be viewed under Valuation.

Option: Reverse a posting, if required:

  1. Open the Reverse Journal Entries – In Asset Accounting app.
  2. Select the journal entry.
  3. Specify the mandatory values.
  4. Choose Reverse.

     

Annual Index Maintenance for 2025

According to the 582nd Sequence of the Tax Procedure Law (Vergi Usul Kanunu Genel Tebliği, Sıra No: 582, published 15.02.2025), inflation accounting will not be applied for the first, second, and third provisional tax periods of 2025 (except for certain exempt taxpayers such as jewelers).
This change means that for 2025, the adjustment will only be performed once at the end of the year (31.12.2025).

Source: TÜRMOB – 2025 Yılı Geçici Vergi Dönemlerinde Enflasyon Düzeltmesi Yapılmayacak 

Following the legal change in February 2025, inflation accounting in Türkiye is now applied annually, not monthly or quarterly.
For 2025, the calculation will be based on the difference between the index value as of 31.12.2024 and the index value as of 31.12.2025.

Since no interim calculation is legally required, companies may enter “0” for the index values from January to November and enter the actual year-end value only in December.

This ensures that the adjustment is calculated exclusively at year-end, as required by law.

Disclaimer: This approach is based on current interpretations. Customers are responsible for verifying its legal validity for their specific case and ensuring compliance from both a regulatory and audit perspective.

 

Automated Index Maintenance via API

Instead of manually maintaining index values in the Maintain Asset Revaluation Index app, you can automate the process using the API API_ASSETREVALUATIONINDEX.
The API allows you to manage both the index header (ID, type, country/currency, unit of measure) and the monthly values (Valid From, Valid To, Index Value) programmatically.

 

Use Case
For example, companies can implement an SAP BTP integration or a partner app that retrieves official TÜİK data each month, validates it, and automatically writes it to their SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system. This removes the need for manual entry and ensures consistent, repeatable index maintenance.

Further Information: API Documentation on SAP Help Portal 

Automated Calculation via BadI

The BAdI FAA_DC_UPA_CUSTOMER with the method SET_PERCENT_VALUE can be used to define formulas for calculating percentage changes automatically.

Example:

Adjustment Coefficient = ((Index value current month / Index value previous month) – 1) * 100

Important: While both SET_PERCENT_VALUE and SET_BASE_VALUE methods are available as of 508, there is a known limitation when using them in scenarios with Periodic Revaluation and Depreciation Split.
In such scenarios, customers should not use the BAdI until this gap is resolved.

Further Information: Overview of Changes in Extensibility Objects 

Support

If you’d like to use the new index type in Türkiye, please create a support incident using the component FI-LOC-FI-TR. To use the feature for other supported countries, use the relevant components.

For more information, refer to the documentation on SAP Help Portal: Maintain Asset Revaluation Index  and Index Type "Replacement Value, Monthly".

Conclusion

The new functionality in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 allows Turkish companies to comply with the legal requirements for inflation accounting and index-based revaluation of assets.

entry.title: SAP User Experience in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Every successful business knows that an exceptional user experience is the crown jewel of their operations. Not only does it enhance efficiency and productivity, but it also fosters customer satisfaction, ultimately leading to sustained growth and success in the competitive market. 

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release introduces a range of innovative enhancements, tailored to refine user interactions and optimize business processes with the help of artificial intelligence. Let's dive into these user experience highlights that will make your business shine. 

TLDR? Check out this video made by my digital twin to get an overview of my highlights:

 


Joule for business 

Speaking of jewels, SAP’s very own AI co-pilot, Joule, introduces advanced intelligent assistance to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, allowing business users to engage with their systems using natural language for quicker and more impactful results. By integrating artificial intelligence within the system, Joule serves as a digital assistant, revolutionizing the way users navigate and utilize business applications. It eliminates technical obstacles by understanding user intent and providing contextually relevant outcomes through intuitive, conversational interactions. 


Joule for consultants 

Joule for consultants is specifically designed to speed up project delivery by offering instant access to a unique, expertly curated SAP knowledge base. This includes over 200,000 pages of documentation and content from SAP communities, helping consultants find answers quickly and saving up to 1.5 hours daily. It also features SAP-specific code intelligence, reducing code interpretation time by up to 40%. Overall, Joule can accelerate project timelines by up to 14%, cutting a typical 12-to-18-month project by 1.5 to 2.5 months. 

 

Joule for developers 

Joule for developers is integrated within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity by aiding in faster code writing, testing, and delivery for ABAP Cloud. For environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, it reduces development time and effort, speeding up value realization. Key features include predictive code completion, a chat feature for natural language queries, code explanation, and support for generating and improving ABAP unit tests and test classes for CDS entities, ensuring reliable applications. 

Design updates for SAP Business Suite consistency 

Navigation has become more seamless than ever with a newly designed navigation menu that removes the extra click previously needed to reach My Home. Users can now effortlessly access their favorite apps and folders from anywhere within the platform, enhancing efficiency. Additionally, personalization through "All Spaces" further improves ease of use. The introduction of the new shell bar maximizes vertical space while prominently displaying the product name. This update needs to be activated using "/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE." Please note that adjustments may be necessary for automated testing. The user menu has been overhauled for greater intuitiveness, featuring larger images, improved spacing, and an easily accessible sign-out button. Notifications have also been refined for better management, allowing users to sort by date or importance with clear categories such as "Today" and "Yesterday." Finally, visual enhancements in Search and Error handling bring a modern touch to the interface, providing users with a smoother and more guided experience. 

Recap feature on My Home 

Moving on to user-centric improvements, the Recap feature is all set to transform how business users stay updated with their My Home enhancements. With a focus on saving time, this intelligent feature highlights the changes since the user’s last login by comparing current data with the past 24 hours. It brings tasks needing attention right to the forefront, streamlining decision-making and increasing productivity by allowing users more time for strategic work. 

Manage News app on My Home 

Meanwhile, the Manage News app strikes at the heart of timely communication. It centralizes internal messages and key updates by enabling the creation and dissemination of news articles directly on My Home. Here, administrators can control visibility, categorization, and the targeted audience of news content, facilitating consistent and streamlined communication across teams. This leads to greater connectivity and informed decision-making within the workforce. 

 AI-assisted UX features

In my last blog post, I introduced some of our AI-assisted UX features, which aim to enhance user interactions by making them more intuitive and efficient through AI-driven capabilities. With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, these AI-assisted UX features are now generally available! We structure them in base features and premium features: 

  • Base features:
    1. AI-assisted enterprise search (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Users can access business data efficiently via natural language queries, enhancing productivity and user experience. Enabling this search feature allows employees to dig through data with queries such as “Show me sales orders in overall status in process" or "Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR”, offering seamless data discovery.


       
    2. AI-assisted easy filter (available through limited promotion in 2502 release): This feature elevates your user experience by allowing filters through natural language, reducing time spent on manual input. Users can enjoy intuitive interactions and explore complex filters with criteria such as currency or date range all supported by generative AI. Access to recent and favorite queries further optimizes user interactions. 


    3. AI-assisted smart summarization (also available through limited promotion in 2502 release): It simplifies data presentation through rich text summaries of object pages. This allows for better business data understanding and efficient sharing across productivity platforms, ensuring smooth collaboration between co-workers and customers. 

       

Kick start your AI journey as an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner by using the base AI-assisted features at no additional costs. The only required action from your side is the acceptance of SAP AI terms for base AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (by one S-user of your company). Afterwards, we will reach out to you with a confirmation of the activation and send over the required, minimal, “last mile configuration” on your side. 

  • Premium features:
    1. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Personalizing your My Home receives a smart upgrade through generative AI, adding insights cards directly with a mere click. It supports various SAP Fiori applications, offering previews for data consistency ensuring quality. 

       

And, as we cannot get enough of our AI-assisted UX, we have some more features waiting for you in beta testing in this release as well! 

  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations on My Home: This feature enhances task efficiency by intelligently adapting the interface for rapid situation resolution. Leveraging AI-driven insights directly from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition homepage, users gain easy access to essential information and actionable steps. This innovation fosters a seamless user experience, reducing the time and effort required for decision-making.

      
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications: You can leverage AI to efficiently incorporate applications through natural language instructions. It allows users to preview and select AI-recommended applications swiftly, significantly enhancing the setup process. This feature is particularly useful for new users, making their interaction with the platform smoother and more intuitive.


  • AI-assisted easy fill: This innovation revolutionizes form completion by using natural language input to automatically map text to appropriate fields, minimizing navigation time and errors. This results in improved accuracy and efficiency in data entry, as users can maintain focus and streamline processes without tedious form-checking. 


  • AI-assisted error explanation: This feature aids in understanding and solving errors within SAP Fiori applications by delivering AI-generated resolution suggestions embedded within the error messages. This facilitates quicker problem-solving and enhances user understanding, particularly for newer users needing guidance on error resolution. 

Our beta testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers early access to new features and innovations, allowing users to experience enhancements firsthand and give feedback to shape the final product. Participants play a key role in influencing development to ensure it meet practical business needs, creating a collaborative link between developers and users for continuous improvement. Want to be part of this journey? Sign up for the beta testing here: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3910  

Collaborative ERP: To-Dos in Microsoft Teams 

Speaking of collaboration, the To-Dos functionality within Microsoft Teams gives users the ability to receive notifications of new tasks directly within their activity feed, enhancing responsiveness and efficiency. This integration facilitates seamless approval processes, allowing end-users to act on situations swiftly, whether it be within Microsoft Teams or directly through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This aims to streamline workflows, support decision-making based on real-time data, and improve team connectivity by centralizing task management within familiar interfaces.

These enhancements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 are designed not only to transform but also to ignite the user experience, bringing an elegant polish to the platform that goes beyond traditional bounds. 

Find out more about SAP User Experience in this blog series by Thomas Reiss. 

Want to learn more about Artificial Intelligence? Check out these blog posts by Yannick Peterschmitt and Sang Dao. Refer to this document for more information.

entry.title: Two-Tier ERP - Cloud ERP Release 2508
entry.content:
We’re excited to share the latest scenarios as part of Two-Tier ERP strategy with the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release. With these new additions, two-tier ERP continues to empower organizations with scalable, agile, and cost-effective ERP solutions that seamlessly integrate headquarters and subsidiaries across diverse business scenarios.

      

Let's go through the highlights of the new innovative scenarios from the space of Supply chain planning, Plant maintenance and Finance which are relevant for the large enterprises with Discrete Industry.

Integrated Business Planning with IBP 

This scenario enables synchronized demand planning between Headquarters and subsidiaries using historical sales data, statistical forecasting, and real-time collaboration to optimize the consolidated plan for procurement and inventory management from the headquarters. IBP uses the historical sales orders data from both the headquarters and subsidiaries and generates statistical forecasted demand based on various forecasting algorithms. The planners in subsidiaries can adjust this local forecasted demand based on special events, promotions etc. and generate a final consensus demand which is then translated to headquarters as Planned Independent Requirements (PIRs) for centralized procurement/production.

 

For details Please refer to the blog post written by my colleagues Kavyanshi and Kangkana:   Two- Tier ERP: Demand Planning with SAP IBP for Headquarter - Subsidiary model

Equipment Refurbishment with Sales & Services Integration 

Two-Tier ERP solution for the process of Equipment Refurbishment with sales & services integration. The two scenarios support seamless refurbishment workflows for leased or rented equipment across Headquarters and subsidiaries, ensuring efficient maintenance, asset tracking, and customer service.  Here are the two possible use cases, 

Scenario 1: Headquarters leases out a high value equipment to the subsidiary on lease basis for a particular time with subsidiary paying monthly rents and spending on equipment maintenance. There is an equivalent lease-in contract at the subsidiary with automatic creation of asset master and manual creation of Equipment master. During Asset maintenance in case the equipment needs refurbishment, it is sent to headquarters for Refurbishment. 

 

Scenario 2: customer places a contract with the subsidiary for an equipment. Equipment is delivered to the customer as a consignment and updated in master as equipment at customer location. The parameters or indicators are maintained in the equipment master. The subsidiary is informed of the repair or service required with the customer and equipment details. Monthly rentals are charged against the contracts for the period equipment is at customer location. Between the customer and subsidiary, vendor invoicing is done for the service or repair carried out on the equipment. The subsidiary decides if the equipment needs repair or refurbishment during annual equipment maintenance through service order. In case of repair, in-house repair is carried out at subsidiary and in case of refurbishment, the damaged equipment is sent to headquarters for Refurbishment with headquarters sending the replaced equipment back to customer via subsidiary. 

 

Please refer to the blogpost written by my colleague Vijayalaxmi : Two-Tier: Refurbishment with Service - SAP Community

Building a Treasury Workstation 

This feature brings in multiple Innovations in Cash and Liquidity Management ensure smooth operation of a treasury workstation in a distributed system environment, enabling data workflows between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private /ECC systems, including Bank Account Management, Cash-Flow and TRM accounting documents.   

   

                                              

Capabilities

  • Two-tier treasury management: accounting document integration routing
  • Bank account unique IDs for cross-system management
  • More Forecasted Flows Supported for Cash-Flow Reconciliation with End-of-Day Bank Statements

​Value Proposition

  • Streamlined operations
  • Improved data traceability and reliability
  • Safeguarded scenarios where the treasury workstation assumes the role of single source of truth for bank account master data
  • Reduced implementation efforts and operational costs for customers and partners who deploy treasury management in the cloud system
  • Enhanced Cash-Flow Replication: both push and pull features are enabled for cash flow replication

entry.title: Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

 

Hello Everyone,

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Sourcing and Procurement line of business continues to evolve, bringing forward innovations that empower procurement professionals to operate with greater agility, transparency, and collaboration. This release focuses on enhancing core procurement processes, integrating intelligent technologies, and improving user experience across the board. Let’s take a closer look at the key updates and how they support your procurement transformation journey.

 

For other releases please see here. Check out all demos in a playlist here.

Operational Procurement

  • Document Management System attachments on the purchase requisition header
  • Ability to provide ad hoc approver for purchase order workflow
  • Reviewer workflow for purchase order approval
  • Enhanced account assignment categories as start conditions for purchase order workflow
  • V4 API for intracompany stock transfer
  • Maintenance of supplier confirmation notes
  • Enable account assignment category Q in Manage Purchase Contracts App
  • Extensibility in manage source lists app
  • Viewing distributed value still to be invoiced in the purchase order items by account assignment app

SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

  • Input tax – Calculation, verification, and validation using external tax engines

SAP Arabia Central Procurement

  • Enablement of single-line distributions from central purchase contracts
  • Procurement Expansion Package

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

Document Management System attachments on the purchase requisition header

The integration of the Document Management System (DMS) at the header level of purchase requisitions marks a significant improvement in how procurement teams manage documentation. Professional purchasers can now attach relevant documents directly to requisitions, with the ability to classify them for internal or external use. While external classification will be supported in future updates, the current functionality already streamlines documentation processes and ensures consistency across SAP Fiori applications such as “Manage Purchase Requisition – Professional” and “Create Purchase Requisition – Advanced.” This enhancement simplifies audit trails, improves traceability, and fosters better collaboration between procurement teams and stakeholders.

 

For more information, see: Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional

Ability to provide ad hoc approver for purchase order workflow

Procurement workflows often require flexibility, especially when exceptional circumstances arise. The introduction of ad-hoc approvers allows authorized users to dynamically add individuals to a workflow instance based on the context of a specific purchase order. This capability ensures that critical decisions are not delayed due to rigid approval chains. The ability to designate multiple ad-hoc approvers and track their involvement in the approval history adds a layer of transparency and responsiveness, making procurement processes more agile and context-aware.

 

For more information, see:  Manage Purchase Orders 

Reviewer workflow for purchase order approval

SAP has introduced a reviewer step in purchase order workflows, allowing designated users to monitor workflow progress and provide feedback without having approval authority. This feature is particularly valuable for organizations that require compliance checks, financial oversight, or legal reviews before finalizing purchases. By enabling user-based or role-based recipient selection and allowing deadline settings, SAP ensures that the review process is both structured and adaptable. This innovation enhances governance and fosters a collaborative approach to procurement decision-making.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders

Enhanced account assignment categories as start conditions for purchase order workflow

The ability to use account assignment categories—such as Internal Order, Asset, and Sales Order—as workflow triggers provides organizations with granular control over procurement approvals. These categories can now be defined as start conditions for purchase order workflows, allowing organizations to tailor approval processes based on financial responsibility and operational context. Additionally, step conditions can be configured to assign specific individuals responsible for each category, ensuring that approvals are targeted and relevant. This supports better financial stewardship and operational alignment.

 

For more information, see:  Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders

 

V4 API for intracompany stock transfer

SAP’s introduction of a new OData V4 API for intracompany stock transfers enables external applications to create, read, update, and delete stock transport orders in real time. This API-driven approach supports seamless integration with external systems, facilitating efficient stock movement across organizational units and enhancing data accuracy. The inclusion of error messaging ensures that invalid data is promptly flagged, reducing the risk of discrepancies and improving overall inventory control.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Stock Transport Order (CE_STOCKTRANSPORTORDER_0001) and Stock Transport Order (OData V4)

Maintenance of supplier confirmation notes

Supplier collaboration is enhanced through the automatic integration of supplier confirmation notes into purchase orders. When suppliers provide notes during the confirmation process, these are now automatically transferred to the corresponding purchase order and its items. This ensures that supplier input is accurately captured and reflected throughout the procurement lifecycle. By reducing manual data entry and minimizing the risk of miscommunication, this feature improves order accuracy and strengthens supplier relationships.

 

For more information, see: Manage Supplier Confirmations

Enable account assignment category Q in Manage Purchase Contracts App

Project-based procurement receives a boost with the inclusion of account assignment category Q (project stock) in the Manage Purchase Contract app. This enables organizations to handle make-to-order scenarios with greater precision, including the management of fields such as WBS elements and GL accounts. By extending support to project procurement, SAP empowers industries like construction, engineering, and manufacturing to align purchasing activities with project timelines and budgets.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see:  Manage Purchase Contracts

Extensibility in manage source lists app

The Manage Source List app has been enhanced to support custom fields, allowing users to store business-specific information that aids in sourcing decisions. Previously, the app did not permit the addition of custom fields, limiting its flexibility. With the new capability, users can define fields of various types—such as string, date, and decimal—and manage them using provided BADIs. This extensibility supports tailored data management and improves the efficiency of source list maintenance.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Source Lists and Overview of Changes in Extensibility Objects

Viewing distributed value still to be invoiced in the purchase order items by account assignment app

Financial transparency is further improved with the ability to view pending invoice values distributed across account assignment splits in purchase order items. When a purchase order item is assigned to multiple cost objects, such as cost centers or internal orders, users can now monitor the open invoice amount proportionally per assignment line. This granular visibility supports accurate accruals, budget tracking, and financial reporting, enabling organizations to maintain tighter control over their expenditures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Purchase Order Items by Account Assignment 

Procurement Expansion Package

The Procurement Expansion Package (PEP) consolidates advanced operational procurement features, catalog content channels, and supplier network capabilities into a single offering. Designed for SAP Cloud ERP customers, PEP delivers comprehensive spend coverage, improved compliance, and enhanced supplier collaboration. It supports a consumer-grade shopping experience, touchless supplier interactions, and end-to-end visibility across procurement processes. By digitizing manual transactions and centralizing procurement data, PEP helps organizations achieve greater efficiency, transparency, and strategic value.

 

For more information, see: Manage Central Purchase Contracts

 

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

Input tax – Calculation, verification, and validation using external tax engines

Tax compliance is a critical aspect of procurement, and SAP addresses this through integration with external tax engines like Vertex and Thomson Reuters in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management. This integration allows for the calculation, verification, and validation of VAT, GST, and other transaction taxes on supplier invoices. By automating tax determination and comparison with supplier-provided data, organizations can prevent overpayments, mitigate compliance risks, and enhance audit readiness. The ability to specify commodity codes and use address data for tax calculation further refines the accuracy of this process.

 

 

For more information, see: Verification of Tax Applied to a Supplier Invoice

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP Ariba Central Procurement

Enablement of single-line distributions from central purchase contracts

Central procurement capabilities have been expanded in two key areas. First, the activation of single-line distribution within central contracts allows organizations to generate individual outline agreements for each contract line item. This is particularly beneficial for industries such as automotive, where scheduling agreements often require single-item configurations. Second, when copying a central contract, users can now edit fields such as supplier and purchasing organization, providing greater flexibility in contract lifecycle management and enabling smoother transitions when suppliers change.

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Central Purchase Contracts

entry.title: What’s New in SAP Central Business Configuration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508
entry.content:
With the latest release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, exciting new features are available in SAP Central Business Configuration. This blog post will provide you with a concise overview.

Additional Localization Scope for Financial Operations

Public Sector, Education & Research in the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release

The 2508 release of SAP Cloud ERP continues to advance digital transformation for (Higher) Education and Research institutions by delivering innovations that enhance operational agility, financial transparency, and research excellence.

A key highlight of this release is the broader international rollout of public sector functionality, including Grants Management, and Budget (Funds) Management,  now available in ten additional countries. This reflects a growing global shift toward modern, cloud-based ERP systems capable of supporting advanced budget and funding models and increasing compliance requirements in the academic and research landscape.

This release also aligns with two major technology trends reshaping the sector: the move toward composable ERP architectures and the deepening integration of AI. Institutions can now take advantage of even more embedded intelligence for real-time decision support. In parallel, enhanced extensibility through SAP Business Technology Platform and API-first design enables tailored solutions for research administration, staff services, and financial operations.

Whether managing a growing research portfolio, aligning budgets with institutional strategy, or driving operational efficiency, the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release offers a robust and future-ready platform!

In this blog, we explore what’s new in the 2508 release for (Higher) Education and Research, including finance, grants, analytics, and localization updates, as well as how these new capabilities support institutions on their journey to an agile institution.

Highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release

Let's start with getting a summary overview of the latest enhancements delivered across Cloud ERP and all of the key business applications. The following video is a great product update summary by Bert Schulze, which will guide you through all the top highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release content:

 

Picture: watch the top highlights of the 2508 release in this video 

Enhancements in Grants & Budget Management

The 2508 SAP Cloud ERP release offers a comprehensive set of capabilities for Grants and Budget Management, tailored for public sector institutions such as state and local governments, municipalities, K-12 schools, and (Higher) Education & Research organizations.

With this latest release, a set of enhancements has been introduced, further strengthening support for (Higher) Education & Research customers globally. Below is an overview of the innovations delivered with this release.

New country versions 

Building on the previous availability in the United States, Germany, Canada, Australia, Austria, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, Belgium, India, Japan, New Zealand, Singapore, and Switzerland, the Public Sector Management (PSM) scope bundle is now also available in the following ten countries:

Denmark, Finland, France, Ireland, Italy, Mexico, Norway, Saudi Arabia, Spain, and Sweden

This industry-specific scope co-developed with and for (Higher) Education & Research supports a wide range of use cases in the financial administration of sponsored research, grants, and funds, now also available for the countries mentioned.

These specialized industry processes are fully integrated with SAP’s broader enterprise capabilities, including core finance, procurement, asset accounting, and project management.

To explore the complete list of available scope items and country-specific details, refer to the SAP Process Navigator.

New Workflow for Earmarked Funds

The Manage Workflows for Earmarked Funds has been enhanced with the enable the workflows for earmarked funds from contract and lease management. You now can determine the approval procedure.

Features:

  • Enablement of workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management
  • Ability to determine the approval procedure

Benefits

  • Enable effective budget control by providing the ability for the budget manager to approve or disapprove the commitment from contract and lease management
  • Improve efficiency by streamlining the approval process
  • Boost collaboration and compliance

  • Save AI-assisted filter criteria as a view and define it as a default view to help make it easier to find the same objects every time, including the ability to save a public or private view

Features:

In the Manage Budget Documents apps where the Easy Filter is enabled, users can easily toggle between AI-Assisted filtering and classic Smart Filters. By typing in a few words in natural language, users can easily filter and sort long lists of objects.

Benefits:

  • Provide one entry point for application navigation based on search results

  • Increase user efficiency by enabling users to find the right object easily and efficiently.

Picture: AI-enabled search and filtering in Budget Documents.

AI-assisted filtering in Managing Earmarked Funds

AI-assisted enterprise search for Public Sector Management objects

Ability to derive the PSM account assignments from statistical WBS elements in case there is no over-ruling from the derived cost center. For example, the ability for the PSM account assignment to be taken from the statistical WBS element if a PSM account assignment is a fixed assignment on a statistical WBS element and no fixed assignment on the cost center.

Benefits

Allow better management of the budget for statistical projects

Features

  • You can automatically derive PSM account assignments from statistical WBS elements when the cost center does not have a fixed assignment.
  • For example, if you set a fixed PSM account assignment on a statistical WBS element and do not set one on the cost center, the system uses the assignment from the statistical WBS element.

 

Picture: Project with profile ‘Statistical’ (PSM derivation on the background)

👉Direct link to Roadmap Explorer: Using statistical projects with public-sector management

 

Availability control & budget address validations during budget Import

During the budget upload through the “Import Financial Plan Data” app, new checks to:

  • Avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC
  • Avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)

Benefits

Improve budget consistency (for example, avoiding unwanted negative budgets)

Features

When you upload a budget using the Import Financial Plan Data app, the system checks your data to help you avoid the following issues:

  • Budget overruns are based on your Availability Control (AVC) settings.
  • Negative amounts for a budget entry that includes all relevant account assignments, such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type.

Picture: Import of budget plan with new (consistency) checks build in.

Position budgeting with funds pre-commitments and budget availability check

  • Enable financing of positions with their corresponding funding sources, such as funds, grants, or functional areas, and monitoring and control of budget consumption
  • Create earmarked fund precommitments in SAP Cloud ERP to reserve the position budget
  • Finance vacant positions

Benefits

Enable accurate budget monitoring and control of personnel expenses by allowing the financing of positions in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Features

When a new employment gets created in SAP SuccessFactors, based on the employment costs, the necessary budget gets reserved in SAP Cloud ERP through an earmarked funds document of type commitment document. When an employee gets hired in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, based on the salary of the employee, the budget gets reserved in the SAP Cloud ERP system through an earmarked funds document, of type Commitment document. During every payroll run for the employee, the existing commitment document gets adjusted with the corresponding payroll actuals amount, and the corresponding actuals document is created and posted in the SAP Cloud ERP.

  • You can finance employees in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central by using Position Budgeting Control for Cloud. The financing uses information from the funds commitment amount in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Position Budgeting Control for Cloud allows you to ensure that employees are sufficiently budgeted for a specified financial period.

Picture: Position Budgeting Control – Financing Details.

entry.title: Unlocking the Power of Custom Test Variants and Test Data Containers for Test Automation
entry.content:
Test variants in automation tools allow you to define the exact input data used during test execution—think specific customers, materials, or document types that matter for your client or implementation.

 What is a Test Variant?
A test variant in Test Automation Tool for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud is a data configuration that feeds into your test script. It contains field-level values mapped to specific UI steps (e.g., Purchase Order Number, Material ID, Quantity).

You can have:
- Multiple variants per script (for regression across data sets)
- Reusable variants across test scripts
- Data-driven automation, where business inputs come from real scenarios

 Step-by-Step: Creating a Custom Test Variant
1. Open Your Test Plan: Navigate to the “Test Your Processes” app.
2. Go to ‘Variants’ Tab: Click Create Variant and select input fields.
3. Enter Test Data: Use business-relevant values (e.g., 1710 for Company Code, NL00 for Supplier).
4. Execute: Select the variant to your script and execute.

Enhancing Test Variants with the Test Data Container (Fiori App ID: F5404)
The Test Data Container (TDC) app provides a central place to define, store, and reuse test data across scripts and test plans. It's the backbone for consistent and scalable data management. Refer TDC Self Help document here

 Key Features of the Test Data Container:
- Centralized Repository: Define test data sets (containers) for different business processes.
- Reusable Inputs: Map containers to multiple test variants to avoid duplication.
- Process-Aware: Access standard containers relevant to your process.
- Preloaded Templates and Containers: SAP provides business area wise templates and ready-to-use containers based on scope items.

 How It Works with Test Variants:
- You create a TDC with relevant master/Organization data (e.g., customer, supplier, plant).
- Link the container to your test variant in the Test Process or Test Plan.
- The system auto-fills test fields from the Test Data container, reducing manual entry and errors.
- Updates to TDC reflect across all linked variants instantly.

Fig 1: TDC linkage to Test Plan

Fig 2: Linkage of TDC and Test Plan variant

 

Best Practices:
- Use clear naming for each container (e.g., TDC_DE_MaterialSet01).
- Keep TDCs versioned if your data evolves across testing cycles.
- Maintain different containers for localization, negative testing, and release regression.

Benefits of Using Test Data Container:

Feature

Benefit

Centralised Management

Avoids redundant data entry across variants

Scalability

Easily reuses business inputs across modules

Flexibility

Create containers for standard or custom use cases

Stability

Improves consistency in test execution outcomes

 

Conclusion
By combining Test Variants with the Test Data Container app (F5404), SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud customers can build resilient, reusable, and maintainable test automation landscapes. This capability ensures consistency across scripts, enhances collaboration, and aligns closely with DevOps principles.

entry.title: Unpacking the new SAP Business Suite
entry.content:
This blog intends to provide a quick explanation of the newly announced SAP Business Suite. The blog contains the latest information as of August 26th 2025.

In February 2025, SAP announced the new SAP Business Suite (https://www.sap.com/events/business-unleashed.html), which was also covered in detail at our prime SAP SAPPHIRE events in Orlando, Madrid, and all the SAP Now events around the world. But you might be wondering what the new SAP Business Suite is.

Simply put, the SAP Business Suite helps our customers drive business innovation to achieve more valuable business outcomes in a constantly changing economy—by uniting core SAP business applications, data, and Business AI capabilities.

New SAP Business Suite

The SAP Business Suite is not simply a harmonization of release and maintenance schedules for SAP’s portfolio of solutions. It serves as a transformation engine, helping customers generate rapid cycles of innovation and continuous improvement as a service. This enables organizations to deliver greater business value and achieve improved outcomes through end-to-end processes.

SAP’s Business Suite applications (like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Concur, etc.) and SAP Business Technology Platform aren’t just siloed applications; they are integrated along end to end business process, supporting you in every business decision and outcome. This integration ensures that every action taken within these applications generates trusted, business-critical data at its source.

Within the SAP Business Suite, we have also integrated the SAP Business Data Cloud. The SAP Business Data Cloud was also announced in February 2025 . The SAP Business Data Cloud centralizes, harmonizes, and enriches the data produced by the SAP applications and non-SAP applications. So the SAP Business Data Cloud helps us unify data into a single source of truth. Now if this data is contextualized, reliable, and accessible, this data becomes the fuel for advanced AI-driven insights. SAP Business AI, included in the SAP Business Suite, goes beyond basic automation. Through SAP Joule, our AI copilot and the embedded AI capabilities in our applications, employees can orchestrate intelligent agents to collaborate across functions or get enhanced scenarios to increase productivity. This strategy breaks down silos, driving real-time, cross-enterprise optimization. We know our customers are deploying AI in isolated projects, but with our SAP Business Suite strategy, we weave it throughout your organization, unlocking value and resilience at scale.

Let’s get practical and explain how our customers consume the SAP Business Suite as a service. Next, I will cover the new SAP Business Suite Packages and the journey our customers can follow to implement them.

SAP has created buying center-based packages which provide our customers with defined functional capabilities within our core applications portfolio, data, and Business AI.  The idea is that the package can provide all the necessary capabilities for this buying center and its teams to carry out their responsibilities.

New buying center-based SAP Business Suite Packages

Now, SAP is providing two journeys for our customers so they can consume the SAP Business Suite as a service. The journeys are RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP. Before the February 2025 announcement, RISE with SAP was focused on our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and GROW with SAP was focused on our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Customer Journeys to New SAP Business Suite

Following the introduction of the SAP Business Suite, we have evolved our programs and made several enhancements to the commercial packages supporting these journeys to better serve our customers.

RISE with SAP is a journey focused on existing SAP ERP on-premise customers who are looking to modernize their legacy systems with SAP Business Suite, while GROW with SAP is a journey focused on new SAP ERP customers looking to start fresh with SAP Business Suite.

We also made changes to some names to group our solutions. We now refer to everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and its extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP," and everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and the extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP Private."

Now, how do we align the SAP Business Suite packages with the customer journeys?  In the figure, you can see that customers have options depending on their SAP journey and buying center. These packages can also be consumed by buying center or brought together for the entire company and buying centers. If you would like to learn more about our packages and what is included, I suggest you visit this link: https://www.sap.com/products/business-suite/pricing.html

Buying center-based packages that enable customer journeys to the new SAP Business Suite

In this blog, I want to focus more on the journeys and packages that have traditionally covered ERP functionalities by highlighting the CIO buying center and the needs of a company-wide system, including other C-suite buying centers who rely on ERP as a comprehensive solution to streamline the introduction of this concept. I won’t cover other subscriptions like add-ons, data product packages, and AI packages included in the SAP Business Suite, etc., to keep it simple and easy to understand.

Let's begin with Cloud ERP Private. This package is designed to provide customers with tailored-to-fit functionality, a very flexible system in which they maintain the governance of the system while SAP supports operations.

Here, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is included; however, this package encompasses many more capabilities and components compared to traditional ERP (SAP ERP 6.0). The following components are included:

Components included in Cloud ERP Private Package - This content is subject to change. For the most current details, please refer to the link below

The SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages include many different SAP components supporting the CFO and COO buying centers in running their business responsibilities. Here is where you find SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a system designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, with rapid and agile innovation cycles, operated and governed by SAP.

Each of these packages includes two types of sub-packages: Base and Premium. The idea is to provide customers with flexibility when deciding on the main capabilities for each buying center. Below, I present the capabilities of the two packages:

Components included in SAP Finance Package - This content is subject to change. For the most current details, please refer to the link below

Components included in SAP Supply Chain Package - This content is subject to change. For the most current details, please refer to the link below

As you can see from the packages, the entitlements provided encompass more comprehensive capabilities and components compared to the standalone SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, offering greater business benefits and functional features.

To view the current packages and included latest capabilities, please refer to: https://www.sap.com/products/business-suite/pricing.html

Sample Customer Journeys:

SAP ERP 6.0 customer looking to move to the new SAP Business Suite.

This customer will use the RISE with SAP customer journey to move to the new SAP Business Suite. Here, the customer will have the option to select between various packages depending on their business needs. Considering that this customer runs full capabilities (FI-CO, SD, MM, PP, QM, etc.) in SAP ERP 6.0, below are the choices:

Customer Journey – RISE with SAP – Final Destination SAP Business Suite

SAP will support the customer with the selection of the right packages by using the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment (SAP DDA). The SAP DDA helps the customer assess functional needs and provides recommendations accordingly. However, it is important to note that the packages are meant to serve two distinct business purposes: Cloud ERP Private—tailored-to-fit functionality with a highly flexible system where the customer maintains governance while SAP supports operations—and SAP Finance & SAP Supply Chain, which is designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, featuring rapid and agile innovation cycles, and operated and governed by SAP.  While the SAP DDA assesses functional requirements, the customer must decide on their main strategy: whether to implement and operate their systems with a tailored-to-fit solution or embrace a fit-to-standard model.

SAP Digital Discovery Assessment

Now let's talk a bit more in detail about the journey based on the package selection.

Cloud ERP Private – An SAP ERP 6.0 customer needs tailored-to-fit functionality, with a very flexible system in which they maintain governance of the system while SAP supports operations. This customer has selected the Cloud ERP Private Package. Here, they first need to plan their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition from SAP ERP 6.0 using one of the known transition paths: New Implementation, Selective Data Transition, or System Conversion. They will benefit from the use of transformation tools and services included in the package and can also take advantage of the other components included in the package.

With the help of the transformation tools included in the package, in conjunction with the RISE with SAP methodology, we recommend that our customers pursue a clean core strategy, so they can remain technically ready in a cost-effective manner to be agile to consume new SAP innovations.

Customer Journey – RISE with SAP – Final Destination SAP Business Suite via Cloud ERP Private Package

SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages – An SAP ERP 6.0 customer decided on a state-of-the-art system designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, with rapid and agile innovation cycles and operated and governed by SAP. This customer has selected the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages. Here, they first need to plan their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition from SAP ERP 6.0 using a New Implementation. They will benefit from using SAP Activate, the SAP Signavio Process Navigator, and SAP Cloud ALM to drive their implementation, and can also take advantage of the other components included in the package (either base or premium).  And remember, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is clean core by definition, using cloud extensibility included in the solution to help our customers differentiate.

Customer Journey – RISE with SAP – Final Destination SAP Business Suite via SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages

To make the most of all the components included in these packages, the SAP Activate Methodology has been enhanced, and there is now a new roadmap available for provisioning SAP Business Suite Packages. I highly recommend using it to take full advantage of the additional components offered.

New SAP Activate for provisioning new SAP Business Suite Packages

New SAP customer looking to move to the new SAP Business Suite.

This customer will use the GROW with SAP customer journey to move to the new SAP Business Suite. Here, the customer will be defaulted to the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain packages, as our SAP Cloud ERP is the most transformational one.

However, if the new customer might be looking for more tailored-to-fit functionality—a very flexible system in which they maintain the governance of the system while SAP supports operations—the Cloud ERP Package can be offered after the review with the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment.

Customer Journey – GROW with SAP – Final Destination SAP Business Suite via SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages

As indicated before to make the most of all the components included in these SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages, the SAP Activate Methodology has been enhanced, and there is now a new roadmap available for provisioning SAP Business Suite Packages.

 

So, what about the other SAP Business Suite packages—SAP Strategic Procurement, SAP Core HR, and SAP CX?

These packages were designed based on personas. They provide our customers with defined functional capabilities within our core applications portfolio, data, and Business AI for a specific line of business. However, in combination with the Cloud ERP Private Package or the SAP Finance & SAP Supply Chain Management Package, they can offer even greater business benefits.

So, as in the example above, if an SAP ERP 6.0 customer is also running a legacy SAP ERP HCM system, they can adopt the new package for SAP Core HR to run SAP SuccessFactors and help them manage strategic human resources with solutions like SuccessFactors Employee Central, SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll, SuccessFactors Time Tracking, etc. SAP SuccessFactors is the next-generation cloud HR product, and this is where we are recommending our customers to move.

If the SAP ERP 6.0 customer is running a legacy SAP SRM 7.0 or any other legacy system to manage strategic sourcing, contract management, or is looking to implement these capabilities, they can choose SAP Strategic Procurement—an integrated solution bundle for managing the source-to-contract process through sourcing, contract management, supplier lifecycle, and performance management. Included solutions are: SAP Ariba Sourcing, SAP Ariba Contracts, SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance.

If the SAP ERP 6.0 customer is running a legacy SAP CRM 7.0 or any other legacy system to manage comprehensive sales management, service management, or marketing capabilities, then the SAP CX Package (to be delivered in Q3 2025) can help the customer leverage the latest CX portfolio, such as SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud.

All Business Suite Packages that are available to existing on-premises SAP ERP 6.0 customers through the RISE with SAP customer journey

The same availability of SAP Business Suite Packages can be provided to a new SAP customer to complement the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management Packages.

All Business Suite Packages that are available to new SAP customers through the GROW with SAP customer journey

As indicated before, the new SAP Business Suite is not just a harmonization of a release and maintenance schedule of SAP’s portfolio of solutions. It’s a transformation engine that helps customers create rapid cycles of innovation end-to-end and continuous improvement as a service. In this regard, SAP is planning to make running the SAP Business Suite easier for customers and is planning to manage the integration of components. Early next year, SAP plans to begin offering SAP Cloud ERP + SAP Core HR managed integration as a service and will continue to introduce more in the future. Of course, these plans are subject to change.

We believe the new SAP Business Suite will help our customers gain more business outcomes by unlocking value and resilience at scale by combining core applications, data and business AI.

Welcome to the 2508 update for everyone looking to grow their revenues with solution-based business models  powered by SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition! As always, there’s a lot to get excited about with this release of the cloud ERP and you can find out about a few of the spotlight features from head of Cloud ERP Product Success Bert Schulze. In this blog we’ll zoom in on new features in the Solution Order Management area which you can put straight into use to grow your solution selling prowess. 
 
If you’re short on time, my AI alter-ego gives a quick summary of the key highlights in the below video….  

 


 
Let's dive into the details of each feature. 
 
Introducing Service Bundles in Solution Orders 
 
Solution bundles have been supported since 2024, enabling the sale of pre-defined stand-alone packages which consist of a mixture of multiple item types, such as physical goods, services and subscription products. With 2502, we expanded on this capability more with the introduction of bundle pricing for greater flexibility, and now in 2508, we again grow the bundle selling capability of Solution Order Management by supporting Service Bundles. From this release, users can benefit from the inclusion of service bundles, either with a fixed-price or time-and-material service bundles, in their solution orders.  

By selling pre-defined packages that can be automatically exploded into their individual components, you not only reduce manual maintenance effort but also minimize the risk of input errors. These service bundles offer robust capabilities similar to a standard service order, including contract determination, price calculation, and more. Once you release a service bundle—or a broader solution bundle containing one—the system automatically generates the corresponding follow-up service order, streamlining the entire fulfilment process from delivery of products to executing the service. 

 

 
Flexible Quantity for Subscription Billing Items 
 
A key facet of solution orders is the ability to sell subscriptions alongside further item types in a single solution order. However, a significant limitation in previous releases was the inability to specify a quantity greater than one for subscription-based items in a solution order. If a customer wished to purchase 20 licenses for 20 different pieces of equipment in a solution order, the highly inefficient process of creating 20 separate subscription line items was required to record and bill corresponding usage data. This not only created excessive manual data entry but also resulted in bloated order documents and complex reporting. 
 
With the 2508 release, we address this operational bottleneck. Within the `Manage Solution Orders` app, the quantity field for any line item categorized for subscription billing is no longer restricted. Users can now simply enter the desired quantity—for instance, 20—in a single line item. In the item view, you’ll see both the aggregated net price for all subscriptions in that item and a detailed breakdown for each individual subscription. Managing them is easier than ever, too: every generated subscription is clearly listed in the transaction history and fully visible in the progress monitor, so you can track execution from order entry through fulfillment with complete transparency. This simple yet critical change radically streamlines the sales process for multi-unit subscriptions and reduces the potential for data entry errors.  

 

Solution Bundle Pricing for Subscription Products  

Whilst we’re on the subject of subscriptions, another key feature being rolled out with the 2508 builds on the bundle pricing functionality linked above. With this release, we now support subscription products with bundle specific pricing meaning subscription products can now have special bundle-specific prices maintained directly in your Subscription Billing tenant, based on solution bundle information. Using the Manage Lookup Table Data app in master data, you can define tailored pricing for subscription items sold as part of a bundle and easily compare it to the price of the same product sold standalone. This flexibility lets you create more attractive offers that encourage customers to choose bundled solutions—driving higher revenue for your solution business. When you release a solution order containing a bundle, the follow-up subscription is generated automatically, with the bundle ID retained for accurate pricing application and easy tracking throughout the subscription lifecycle. 
 

 

 

Flexible determination of dates in solution order processing 

With 2508, we have enhanced the flexibility of solution selling by enabling the adjustment of certain date parameters in a solution order. In many industries, particularly those with long sales cycles or international operations, a single order date is insufficient. For example, a contract might be signed in one fiscal period, but delivery and invoicing occur in the next, requiring a different posting date for accurate operational reporting. Similarly, pricing might be fixed based on a promotional period that has already passed, or a customer may request a specific future delivery date that dictates logistics planning. Without the ability to set these dates independently, organizations resort to manual overrides or complex workarounds which could introduce a higher risk of errors in revenue recognition, customer billing, and supply chain execution. 
 
With this in mind, we’ve enabled more flexible date entry within the `Manage Solution Orders` application. Users can now explicitly set and manage several key dates at the solution order header level and under the new enhanced date profile on the sales item level. 
 

  • Posting Date: Used for reporting and search purposes in the solution order. 
  • Pricing Date: Determines the exact date for which price conditions, exchange rates, and taxes are applied, allowing for precise control over contract profitability 
  • Billing Date: Sets the baseline date for generating billing documents, providing flexibility in scheduling customer invoices. 
  • Requested Delivery Date: The date communicated by the customer for when goods or services should be received. This date is now a primary input for the Available-to-Promise (ATP) check and subsequent delivery scheduling. 

 

This granularity ensures that each downstream process—from logistics to finance—is driven by the correct temporal data, leading to greater accuracy and process automation. 
 

 
Tolerant Handling of Incomplete Sales Orders: Incompleteness Checks for Sales Orders from Solution Orders 

By using sales order type OR, you can create sales orders directly from a solution order even when some mandatory information is missing, thanks to built-in incompleteness checks. This means follow-up documents can still be generated, while the system flags any missing data for review. In the progress monitor, these sales orders appear in a distinct red status, making it clear that action is needed. Incompleteness procedures help you identify and address gaps before further processing, and any orders with incomplete information are clearly listed in the SAP Fiori app “List Incomplete Sales Documents”.  

 

Contract Accounts Supported for Service Contract Items 

With the 2508 release, service contract items in Solution Order Management now support FI-CA (Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable)—a specialized subledger for high-volume billing and receivables. Building on functionality first introduced in 2502 for sales and subscription items, contract accounts can be maintained at both header and item levels, transferred to follow-up documents on release, and posted directly to FI-CA for streamlined invoicing, payment handling, and financial tracking. This integration centralizes financial data, improves billing accuracy, and provides a clear, consolidated view of customer transactions. 

Pricing Analysis in Solution Orders 
 

In the 2508 release of Solution Order Management, a new price analysis capability makes it easier than ever to verify that pricing has been executed correctly on sales order items, service order items, and service contract items. A newly added Analyze button in the Price Details view lets you drill down into a comprehensive price breakdown for each solution order item, with full visibility into how each price condition was determined. This gives you greater transparency, control, and confidence in your pricing—right where you need it. 


 
Partner data enabled on item level for sales items 
 
A solution sale can often involve multiple stakeholders. With this in mind, in 2508, we enable the partner determination procedure `SAI00003` for sales item categories within solution orders. This enhancement allows users to navigate to any sales line item in the `Manage Solution Orders` app and specify unique partner functions. You can now have one line item with a specific ship-to party and end-user, and another line item within the same order with completely different partners. This information then flows seamlessly to all follow-up documents generated from the solution order, ensuring that deliveries are routed to the correct addresses and invoices are sent to the appropriate contacts, all while maintaining the integrity of the single, comprehensive solution order.  

Solution Order Management OData API V4 Enhancements 

With the previous release, we introduced the enhanced solution order OData V4 API. This updated API optimizes communication, reduces data transfer payloads, and enhances request handling for faster processing and lower resource use, leading to quicker response times and a better user experience. It supports full CRUD operations for managing solution order items, so with 2508 we have expanded its scope to include the new functions described above, including subscription items with greater quantities, and service bundles. Importantly, we have rounded-off the ability to create a solution order touch-free by now supporting subscription billing items via the API operations, enabling specialists to generate solution orders entirely via API containing all possible item types. Additionally, it is easier to identify the documents created from the solution order for further processing and set this up without manual intervention.  

A further API enhancement we are excited to introduce with this release enables you to simulate a solution order in an external quotation system to get accurate and up-to-date values. This is a big step towards more seamless order entry, enabling customers to generate quotes with minimal revisions, delivering a faster turn-around time for quotation conversion and order fulfilment.  


 

 

More Information

entry.content:
Hello and welcome to this blog covering the release highlights for localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508. In our mission to help you run your business everywhere, we are continuously expanding our global footprint and enhancing our solutions to meet the specific legal and business requirements of countries around the world. This release is packed with significant advancements, including a brand-new local version for Vietnam, a peek into the future with AI for tax calculations, major strides in our self-service localization tools, and expanded integration with Taulia.

Localization

  • Vietnam Local Version
  • Beta Campaign AI understanding tax calculation
  • CLT GA and LaaSS
  • Taulia Integration
  • Help Documentation/ Release restriction Note

Let’s dive into the details!


Expanding Our Global Reach: Welcome, Vietnam!

We are very proud to announce the delivery of our latest local version for Vietnam. This addition empowers businesses to operate seamlessly within the Vietnamese market, ensuring full compliance with local financial regulations and business practices right out of the box.

Value Proposition: This new local version significantly reduces the complexity and risk of entering or operating in the Vietnamese market. By providing pre-configured content that adheres to local laws and standards, we enable you to accelerate your implementation, ensure compliance, and focus on your core business activities with confidence in your financial data and reporting.

Capabilities: The Vietnam local version is a comprehensive package designed to meet your core financial needs. It includes a country-specific chart of accounts mapped to the Vietnamese Accounting Standards (VAS) and pre-configured VAT and withholding tax procedures. To meet statutory requirements, we deliver critical reporting capabilities, including the VAT report and declaration, and a specific withholding tax report (form 01/NTNN). You can also manage electronic invoicing for outbound scenarios and generate key financial statements like the trial balance, balance sheet, and profit and loss reports, all formatted according to VAS.


A Glimpse into the Future: AI-Powered Tax Calculation Insights

Imagine a world where complex tax calculations are no longer a black box. We are currently running a beta campaign for a groundbreaking feature that uses the power of SAP Business AI and our digital assistant, Joule, to provide instant clarity on tax determination. This is a significant step forward in making tax management more transparent and user-friendly.

Value Proposition: This innovation empowers finance users by providing on-demand, easy-to-understand explanations for tax calculations directly within their workflow. This transparency saves valuable time, reduces the risk of posting errors, and allows for proactive corrections, ultimately leading to more accurate financial data and improved operational efficiency.

Capabilities: With "Understanding tax calculations," users can ask Joule how the tax in a specific business document was calculated. Joule will provide a clear, contextual explanation of the tax determination, detailing the specific parameters and rules that influenced the outcome. This allows users to make informed decisions and any necessary corrections *before* an item is posted, moving from reactive problem-solving to proactive validation.

Register for Beta testing here: Understanding Tax Calculations with Joule - Customer Influence Page

Testing scope is limited to Sales Order Posting for India


Empowering You: Localization-as-a-Self-Service (LaaSS) and CLT General Availability

Flexibility and customer empowerment are at the heart of our strategy. With the 2508 release, we are thrilled to announce that the Configuration Localization Tool (CLT) is now generally available. This, combined with our ongoing Localization-as-a-Self-Service (LaaSS) innovations, gives you unprecedented control to extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud to countries beyond our standard delivered versions.

Value Proposition: CLT and our LaaSS innovations provide you with the speed and agility to support your global business rollouts. You are no longer limited to the 60 SAP-delivered local versions. This self-service approach allows you and your partners to create compliant localizations for over 160 additional countries, dramatically accelerating project timelines and tailoring the system to your unique global footprint.

Capabilities: The now generally available Configuration Localization Tool (CLT) enables you to create a new customer local version by using an SAP-delivered country version as a reference. The tool intelligently generates the necessary configuration, which you can then deploy to your system. We are further enhancing this with two new scope items (7VW and 7WP) that enable invoice-time withholding tax and bill of exchange processing for all CLT-created local versions. Additionally, we are pushing the boundaries of extensibility with a labs preview for using SAP Business AI to manage localized form templates and providing self-service configuration for electronic freight invoices in Brazil.


Strengthening Your Financial Supply Chain: Taulia Integration Expands to Canada

Optimizing working capital is a top priority for every CFO. Our seamless, embedded integration with Taulia helps you unlock liquidity trapped in your accounts receivable. With this release, we are excited to extend this powerful capability to our customers in Canada.

Value Proposition: The embedded Taulia Receivables Financing solution for Canada enables you to improve cash flow, reduce reliance on traditional debt, and strengthen your balance sheet. By converting receivables into cash within 24 hours, you can fund growth, manage seasonal fluctuations, and optimize financial metrics—all without ever leaving your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.

Capabilities: Now available in Canada, this solution allows you to sell eligible receivables to a multi-funder network with just a few clicks. The process is seamless, from invoice creation in S/4HANA Cloud to AI-powered pricing and funding. The automated journal entries and payment records ensure touch-free reconciliation, freeing up your finance team for more strategic tasks. Furthermore, the financing is undisclosed, meaning your customer relationships are preserved while you gain the financial flexibility your business needs.

Help Documentation/ Release restriction Note

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508, Local Versions, Release Restriction Note

Thank you for joining me for this overview of our 2508 localization highlights. We are committed to being your trusted partner on your journey to becoming an intelligent, sustainable enterprise.
